posts.post_content:
@SoulsDescend
  
   
You are making the mistake of reading this creature as just a big mana sink with all his powers stacked on top of each other. Most often you will throw your spare mana into this guy.
  
   
Stillmoon Cavalier is all about options. For example you need to get that last 3 damage to kill your opponent, sink 3 mana to make him a 3/1 with flying to kill your opponent. Or lets say you need to block a 2/2, pay 1 to make him have first strike and kill that 2/2 or depending on the mana you have open a,
  
3/3 or 4/4 ect..
  
   
Also many people forget how usefull the protection is. It allows him to remain unblockable against any white or black creatures, he can also block cards like baneslayer without dying.
  
   
He is also imune to some very powerfull kill spells path to exil, unmake, oblivion ring, ect...
  
   
@Revelation666
  
   
I have been playing mono-black zombies since 1999 and I love them more than any tribal type. While I do love Stillmoon Cavalier I feel that he takes up the 3 dro... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Back in the day, people played [Ihsan's Shade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ihsan's Shade) because there were no black removal spells that could kill black creatures, and the only other spot removal spells were white. Now with stuff like [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate), [Putrefy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrefy), and [Maelstrom Pulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Pulse), being black no longer offers as much protection. Which is why this guy is so awesome, because unless you're playing against a red deck, he is basically immune to all removal except for red burn. Possibly the most removal-resistant creature in the game that doesn't have some form of shroud. If you really feel you must put things on him, play him in a white/green or black/green deck and [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) him without fear.
posts.html:
Back in the day, people played Ihsan's Shade because there were no black removal spells that could kill black creatures, and the only other spot removal spells were white. Now with stuff like Terminate, Putrefy, and Maelstrom Pulse, being black no longer offers as much protection. Which is why this guy is so awesome, because unless you're playing against a red deck, he is basically immune to all removal except for red burn. Possibly the most removal-resistant creature in the game that doesn't have some form of shroud. If you really feel you must put things on him, play him in a white/green or black/green deck and Giant Growth him without fear.

posts.post_content: I've run him in my doran deck before, back when people were still going gaga over [vampire hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vampire  hexmage) - [dark depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark depths). Made marit alge look absolutely stupid lol. It was a miracle i wasn't slapped by the guy across the table. This card is unbelievably useful. Just watch out for burn decks. Otherwise, this guy can take you places hehehehe.

posts.post_content: I love this guy, as he adds another creature that is usable in my [pestilence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pestilence) deck, alongside [cemetary gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cemetary gate) which admittedly sucks. posts.post_content:
The problem is now there's green removal that can nail him. [Hornet Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hornet Sting) and [Plummet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plummet), although both incredibly narrow, are also surprisingly useful in any mono-green.  
  
I'm also surprised no one has mentioned efficient burn cards such as [Forked Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forked Bolt), [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail), [Electrolyze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Electrolyze) (I shot down a fresh [Plated Geopede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plated Geopede) and [Steppe Lynx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steppe Lynx) with this beauty), (Which I personally use in Counterburn) [Gut Shot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gut Shot) (playable in ALL decks, including ones without basic [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain)s, so take care he doesn't get splash-hated by anti-[Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets) decks), format all-star [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) and his pal [Searing Blaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Searing Blaze), Classic Goodie [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball), [Disintegrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disintegrate), [Red Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Red Sun's Zenith), [Magma Spray](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Magma Spray), Kam... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: this card really tares down about 90% of all decks white and black are by far the most used colors and he really tares down decks that have a lot of one or a another or both of them down. He is also great when facing green decks. Flying pretty much makes you unblockable when facing green and most green anti fliers wont work such as [windstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=windstorm) and [Gravity Well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravity Well) because he doesn't have flying until you want him to and generally specking blue dose not have a lot of fliers ether. half fire breathing may not seem like much but he is pretty much unblockable and it works well with first strike really the only decks he is not awesome ageist are burn.
